question:
You recently saw an advertisement in a newspaper seeking volunteers to do unpaid work with local children. You are interested in this work. Write a letter to the head of the organisation. In your letter

– express your interest
– ask for details of the work that needs to be done
– let them know when you are available.
text: I am writing this letter in connection with your advertisement about the unpaid job working with juniors. Since I have been passionate about working with children it is in my best interest to get as much experience as I could so as to be able to open my own organization to help kids.

I would like to explain some of my interests in your work. Honestly, I have been working with children for more or less five years and I have always felt blessed to be able to give and teach them the things they need. I, furthermore, am pretty patient with youngsters and I have a great relationship with them.

Well, I would be grateful if you could give me details of the work. Can you tell me how many days of the week I could work and for how long each day? Also, I would appreciate it if you could tell me what are your requirements for a non-paid employee?

Lastly, since I currently work with thousands of students I'm not able to be part of your team until the end of January, however, after this month I am available on Monday till Thursday from 8 AM until 3 PM.
Anyway, this is all I would like to share with you. Thank you for taking the time for reading this letter.
